Articles.Content:
Okay, so here's the challenge:

Kerbals, wanting to make a new movie "Gravioli," where one kerbal "Sandra Kerman" desperately tries to escape a large case of kessler syndrome, having to go through various dangerous situations to survive.

however, kerbals have no experience whatsoever with CGI and Visual Animation, causing them to create a actual cloud of debris to act the movie.

Objectives: (0 = optional)

Create a cloud of debris that has at least 20 different entities. (Put command modules on them so they don't delete.)

Have two stations. (Can be already constructed ones.)

Have at least 1 impact with an station.

Travel to both stations.

Doesn't have to be "sandra kerman."

Spend all of the fuel in the module you use to travel between stations.

Kerbal successfully returns to Kerbin.

Stations have to be farther than 2km apart

Do this as fast as you can. (Don't try to dock with the station when traveling to it.)

0) Leap of faith. Leap and from the module you use to travel and cling to the station.

0) Randomize each debris/not all the same.

0) Sandra Kerman

0) Have another kerbal that doesn't survive.

Scoring: If you follow all of the objectives, you get 100 points.

Extra scoring:

Each extra debris adds 1 point.

Each optional objective you complete gets 25 points.

If you go above and beyond; 20 points for every aspect you went above and beyond on.

5+ points for every extra kerbal you bring on the mission and successfully land.

20+ points if you create a shuttle and it gets hit by debris.

50+ for every extra large station you construct.
